intro: Schoenus unispiculatus, commonly known as the single-bristled sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Schoenus unispiculatus plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various small organisms.
